pullRequest.title: AWS: support Server Side Encryption for S3FileIO
pullRequest.bodyText:
add support for server side encryption (3 types: S3, KMS, Custom) for S3FileIO
add corresponding integration tests
add AwsCatalogProperties as the centralized place to put all AWS related catalog properties
also fix warnings in S3URI

nodes.bodyText: Q: Why isn't the parent super.close() inside the try block as well?
I assume these tests are not part of the regular build?

As mentioned in #1767, it would be nice to wrap these properties in AwsCatalogProperties as a utility class and just keep reference to the properties as opposed to enumerating them here an in BaseS3File.
I'm trying to understand the reason for these (and below split changes).  Is this relevant to the larger PR?  My understanding is that this really doesn't change the behavior.
These four types might make sense to turn into an enumeration.  Also, are these official names for the encryption types?  I just find s3 not to be terribly descriptive for the type of encryption.

+package org.apache.iceberg.aws;
+
+public class AwsCatalogProperties {
+
+  private AwsCatalogProperties() {
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * Type of S3 Server side encryption used, default to {@link AwsCatalogProperties#S3_SSE_TYPE_NONE}.
+   */
+  public static final String S3_SSE_TYPE = "s3-sse-type";
+
+  /**
+   * No server side encryption.
+   */
+  public static final String S3_SSE_TYPE_NONE = "none";

nodes.bodyText: We might want to consider shortening this to just AwsProperties because while you can define them at the catalog level, tables can deviate and it would make sense to tune various properties for specific datasets within a catalog.

nodes.bodyText: As I mentioned in the comment above, this is what I think we want to try to avoid where we have to add constructor params per property we need to add.  There are already a few others we need to push through (multipart size, canned acl, etc.).  I think turning the AwsProperties into a wrapper would help as we expand this functionality.

commit.message: support Server Side Encryption for S3FileIO

afterCommit.message: support Server Side Encryption for S3FileIO
